channel.title: Gay fucking maths teacher
channel.description:
Every fucking week we get given a shit-tonne of homework to complete in maths. I take it my maths teacher is just shit because every single homework we get given there is stuff we have never been taught or heard of before. Plus I cannot remember learning anything at all from this guy...
RAGEEE AT MATHS
So anyways heres a question I can't do. plz explain etc.
[IMG]http://i125.photobucket.com/albums/p80/davidude36/sfargeg.jpg[/img]

item.title: Gay fucking maths teacher
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’m not talking about C1.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay fucking maths teacher
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:30, topic:244902”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=321311.msg2557284#msg2557284 date=1227981494]

We have statistics now, no more maths, and our teacher still uses tables for normal/binomial/etc distributions. He’s fucking retarded, using a calculator you’ll get the answer in no time.

what use is that in a non-calculator exam?
[/quote]

Why the hell wouldn’t you use the means you have available to you? Do you measure the size of your house with a tape measure or with your feet? If you have a tape measure, there is no reason why you would measure it with your feet. Of course, if you don’t have a tape measure you’ll do it with your feet. But to calculate something like normal distributions, you need a calculator anyway. Unless you are some uber math genius.[/quote]
the fact that C1 is a non calculator paper and that by using one you fail id say thats a pretty good reason not to use one

Read full topic

item.title: Gay fucking maths teacher
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:32, topic:244902”]A table is the same as a calculator: an aid.

I agree that knowing how to use a calculator won’t get you far by itself. Knowing how to calculate the values given in the table is far more important then having the table. But again, the tables I’m talking about are nothing more then aids (plural of aid, not the disease) to speed up the process of finding certain values. To be able to use the table, you have to do some calculation. So why won’t you do the complete calculation with a calculator? It is even faster, and the answer is more accurate then the table.[/quote]
Yeah I understand that, it’s just the fact that doing it the longer way proves you are a brainless idiot who is ready to be appointed head of a company.

Longer education = Longer zombification = Higher job placement after education.

Read full topic

@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

A table is the same as a calculator: an aid.

I agree that knowing how to use a calculator won’t get you far by itself. Knowing how to calculate the values given in the table is far more important then having the table. But again, the tables I’m talking about are nothing more then aids (plural of aid, not the disease) to speed up the process of finding certain values. To be able to use the table, you have to do some calculation. So why won’t you do the complete calculation with a calculator? It is even faster, and the answer is more accurate then the table.

item.title: Gay fucking maths teacher
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Why the hell wouldn’t you use the means you have available to you? Do you measure the size of your house with a tape measure or with your feet? If you have a tape measure, there is no reason why you would measure it with your feet. Of course, if you don’t have a tape measure you’ll do it with your feet. But to calculate something like normal distributions, you need a calculator anyway. Unless you are some uber math genius.

I think maths is a lot more theoritcal learning/applying knowledge. It isn’t the fact that you can solve equations on a calculator, its the fact you can learn them and store and solve them in your head, it’s a sort of skill.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay fucking maths teacher
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:11, topic:244902”]4(x+2)^2-15
4 * (x+2)(x+2) - 15
4 * (x^2+4x+4) - 15
(4x^2 + 16x + 16) - 15
4x^2 + 16x + 1

Yeah
4(x-2)^2-3 must be right because the one mujahed wrote gave a positive where we needed a negative.[/quote]

Yeah I see where I went wrong actually. Let me try this:

4x^2 - 16x +1
4(x^2 - 4x) + 1
4(x^2 - 4x + (2)^2 - (2)^2) + 1
4(x-2)^2 +1 - 16
4(x-2)^2 -15

I still seem to get -15… Anyway I’m too sleepy now, Good luck!

Read full topic
